question: What are the names of disaster projects advertised before 2023
raw_answer: Westward Beach Road Shoulder Repairs, Outdoor Warning Sirens - Design, Trancas Canyon Park Slope Stabilization, Storm Drain Master Plan, Guardrail Replacement Citywide
evidence_answer: Westward Beach Road Shoulder Repairs, Outdoor Warning Sirens - Design, Trancas Canyon Park Slope Stabilization, Storm Drain Master Plan, Guardrail Replacement Citywide

Disaster Projects (Completed)

Citywide Guardrail Replacement
Project Description: This project consisted of replacing the damaged guardrails throughout
the City caused by the Woolsey Fire on Encinal Canyon Road, Corral Canyon Road, and
Kanan Dume Road.

The project was combined with the County of Los Angeles’ damaged
guardrails. The project was completed in February 2021.

The improvements modified the existing concrete
channel underneath Civic Center Way by adding a 3’ concrete curb adjacent
to the existing flap gates.

The new curb prevents brackish water intrusion

into the City’s Civic Center Stormwater Treatment Facility. This project is
scheduled to be accepted by the Council at the January 24, 2022 meeting.

awarded a FEMA Hazard Mitigation grant to fund the design, engineering and
